p: Coronaviruses have a single-stranded positive RNA of nearly 30 Kbp, a spheroidal shape, and a diameter of 80–120 nm. Their envelope contains the spike –S-, membrane -M-, and envelope -E-, proteins, and the nucleocapsid -N- inside the virion that covers the RNA ( 23). On the genome, from 5′ to 3′, are located the genes for the replicases ORF 1a,b which occupy two thirds of the genome and code for the polyproteins pp1a and pp1b ( 9, 23, 29). Located toward the 3′ end are the genes for structural proteins S, E, M, and N ( 9, 23, 30).
